verses.roman:
e mādhuryāmṛta pāna sadā yei kare
tṛṣṇā-śānti nahe, tṛṣṇā bāḍhe nirantare

synonyms: e—this; mādhurya-amṛta—nectar of sweetness; pāna—drinks; sadā—always; yei—that person who; kare—does; tṛṣṇā-śānti—satisfaction of thirst; nahe—there is not; tṛṣṇā—thirst; bāḍhe—increases; nirantare—constantly.
translation: The thirst of one who always drinks the nectar of that sweetness is never satisfied. Rather, that thirst increases constantly.
